briefdescription.para: The small image will grow from the center of the large image.
The small image will grow from the middle of the left side of the large image.
The small image will grow from the middle of the right side of the large image.

The small image will grow from the bottom left corner of the large image.
The small image will grow from the bottom right corner of the large image.
A ZoomMode describes in which direction the image will grow/shrink when do a zoom animation.

detaileddescription.para: A FIXED direction means that the image will not grow/shrink in that direction.

briefdescription.para: Sets the opacity (alpha value).

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to fade it away by gradually decreasing the alpha value from 255 (solid) to 0 (invisible).

parameterdescription.para: The new alpha value. 255=solid, 0=invisible.

simplesect.para: The user code must call invalidate() in order to update the display.

briefdescription.para: Sets a delay on animations done by the ZoomAnimationImage.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to 0 which means that the animation starts immediately.

parameterdescription.para: The delay in ticks.

briefdescription.para: Associates an action to be performed when the animation ends.

parameterdescription.para: The callback to be executed. The callback will be given a reference to the ZoomAnimationImage.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the bitmap of the image to be used.

detaileddescription.para: The bitmaps should represent the same image in the two needed static resolutions.

parameterdescription.para: The image in the smallest resolution.
The image in the largest resolution.

simplesect.para: getSmallBitmap, getLargeBitmap
The size of the bitmaps do not in any way limit the size of the ZoomAnimationImage and it is possible to scale the image beyond the sizes of these bitmaps.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width and height of the image.

parameterdescription.para: The new width.
The new height.

simplesect.para: ZoomAnimationWidget diverts from the normal behavior by automatically invalidating which causes a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the height of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new height.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
ZoomAnimationWidget diverts from the normal behavior by automatically invalidating which causes a redraw.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t x, int16_t y, int16_t width, int16_t height)
memberdef.name: setPosition

briefdescription.para: Sets the size and position of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

detaileddescription.para: The same as calling setXY(), setWidth() and setHeight() in that order.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of this Drawable relative to its parent.
The y coordinate of this Drawable relative to its parent.
The width of this Drawable.
The height of this Drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
ZoomAnimationWidget diverts from the normal behavior by automatically invalidating which causes a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the algorithm to be used.

detaileddescription.para: In short, there is currently a value for fast (nearest neighbor) and a value for slow (bilinear interpolation). Default is ScalableImage::NEAREST_NEIGHBOR since moving images do not need to be of the best quality, until they stop moving. If the image moves only a little bit, or moves/resizes slowly, consider using ScaleableImage::BILINEAR_INTERPOLATION.

parameterdescription.para: The algorithm to use when rendering.

simplesect.para: ScalableImage::ScalingAlgorithm, getScalingMode

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new width.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
ZoomAnimationWidget diverts from the normal behavior by automatically invalidating which causes a redraw.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t endX, int16_t endY, int16_t endWidth, int16_t endHeight, uint16_t duration, ZoomMode zoomMode=FIXED_LEFT_AND_TOP, EasingEquation xProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone, EasingEquation yProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone, EasingEquation widthProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone, EasingEquation heightProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone)
memberdef.name: startZoomAndMoveAnimation

briefdescription.para: Setup and starts the zoom and move animation.

detaileddescription.para: At end of the animation the image will have been resized to the endWidth and endHeight and have moved from its original position to the endX and endY. Please note that the ZoomMode might influence the actual end position since the zoom transformation might change the X and Y of the image. The ZoomMode FIXED_LEFT_AND_TOP ensures that the endX and endY will be the actual end position.

The development of the width, height, X and Y during the animation is described by the supplied EasingEquations. The container is registered as a TimerWidget and automatically unregistered when the animation has finished.

parameterdescription.para: The X position of the image at animation end. Relative to the container or view that holds the ZoomAnimationImage.
The Y position of the image at animation end. Relative to the container or view that holds the ZoomAnimationImage.
The width of the image at animation end.
The height of the image at animation end.
The duration of the animation measured in ticks.
(Optional) The zoom mode that will be used during the animation. Default is FIXED_LEFT_AND_TOP.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the X position during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the Y position during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the width during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the height during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t endWidth, int16_t endHeight, uint16_t duration, ZoomMode zoomMode=FIXED_LEFT_AND_TOP, EasingEquation widthProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone, EasingEquation heightProgressionEquation=&EasingEquations::linearEaseNone)
memberdef.name: startZoomAnimation

briefdescription.para: Setup and starts the zoom animation.

detaileddescription.para: At end of the animation the image will have been resized to the endWidth and endHeight. The development of the width and height during the animation is described by the supplied EasingEquations. The container is registered as a TimerWidget and automatically unregistered when the animation has finished.

parameterdescription.para: The width of the image at animation end.
The height of the image at animation end.
The duration of the animation measured in ticks.
(Optional) The zoom mode that will be used during the animation. Default is FIXED_LEFT_AND_TOP.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the width during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.
(Optional) The equation that describes the development of the height during the animation. Default is EasingEquations::linearEaseNone.

simplesect.para: The animation follows the specified ZoomMode so the X and Y coordinates of the image might change during animation.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current animation state and reset the animation counter.

parameterdescription.para: The new state.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t endWidth, int16_t endHeight, uint16_t duration, ZoomMode zoomMode, EasingEquation widthProgressionEquation, EasingEquation heightProgressionEquation)
memberdef.name: startTimerAndSetParameters

briefdescription.para: Starts timer and set parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Contains code shared between startZoomAnimation() and startZoomAndMoveAnimation(). If both delay and duration is zero, the end position and size is applied and the animation is ended immediately.

parameterdescription.para: The end width.
The end height.
The duration.
The zoom mode.
The width progression equation.
The height progression equation.

briefdescription.para: Chooses the optimal rendering of the image given the current width and height.

detaileddescription.para: If the dimensions match either the small or large bitmap, that will be used, otherwise the large image will be scaled using the defined scaling mode.

simplesect.para: setScalingMode, setBitmaps

briefdescription.para: Calculates the change in X and Y caused by the zoom animation given the current ZoomMode.
Class for optimizing and wrapping move and zoom operations on a ScalableImage.

detaileddescription.para: The ZoomAnimationImage takes two bitmaps representing the same image but at a small and a large resolution. These bitmaps should be the sizes that are used when not animating the image. The ZoomAnimationImage will use an Image for displaying the Bitmap when its width and height matches either of them. When it does not match the size of one of the bitmaps, it will use a ScalableImage instead. The main idea is that the supplied bitmaps should be the end points of the zoom animation so that it ends up using an Image when not animating. This is, however, not a requirement. You can animate from and to sizes that are not equal the sizes of the bitmaps. The result is a container that has the high performance of an ordinary image when the size matches the pre-rendered bitmaps. Moreover it supplies easy to use animation functions that lets you zoom and move the image.

simplesect.para: Since this container uses the ScalableImage it has the same restrictions as a ScaleableImage, i.e. 1bpp is not supported.
